description.narrative: This initiative establishes a Partnership Framework between AusAID and United Nations relief and Works Agency (UNRWA). The Palestinian National Authority is progressively establishing state-like institutions on the West Bank and HAMAS authorities operate quasi-government structures in Gaza, however UNRWA remains the primary human services provider for the Occupied Palestinian Territories. For most Palestinian refugees, UNRWA is the only significant provider of services, particularly in Lebanon where refugee access to Lebanese government services and assistance is extremely limited. Overall approximately 4.7 million people come under UNRWA's mandate. Increasing numbers and the high dependency of many Palestinian's is straining UNRWA's ability to provide the services so many depend on. The partnership provides for funding and performance assessment of UNRWA's programs of support to Palestinian refugees. The total value of this initiative is $11.9 million over 2 years, starting 2010-11.
